title: Introduction: The Digital Monograph
creator: Jane Scholar
description: This opening chapter introduces the concept of digital monographs and their role in modern scholarly publishing. We explore how digital platforms enable new forms of engagement with academic content.
subject: digital publishing; scholarly communication; monographs

title: Historical Context of Publishing
creator: Jane Scholar
description: Understanding the evolution of scholarly publishing from print to digital requires examining the technological and cultural shifts of the past century. This chapter traces that journey.
subject: history of publishing; print culture; digital transformation

title: Design Principles for Digital Reading
creator: Jane Scholar
description: How do we design effective reading experiences for the web? This chapter examines typography, layout, and navigation principles that make digital monographs accessible and engaging.
subject: web design; typography; user experience; accessibility

title: Navigation and Discovery
creator: Jane Scholar
description: Digital monographs must balance linear reading with exploratory navigation. We examine table of contents systems, chapter navigation, and discovery features.
subject: navigation design; information architecture; reading interfaces

title: CollectionBuilder as Publishing Platform
creator: Jane Scholar
description: CollectionBuilder's flexible, static site approach makes it an ideal platform for digital monographs. This chapter explores how to leverage CB's features for scholarly publishing.
subject: CollectionBuilder; static sites; Jekyll; digital publishing platforms

title: Conclusion: Future of Digital Monographs
creator: Jane Scholar
description: As we look toward the future, digital monographs continue to evolve. This final chapter considers emerging trends and possibilities for scholarly communication.
subject: future of publishing; open access; digital scholarship
